result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Gilberto A Cortez in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Gilberto A Cortez.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A or B/Speedway, Pick in Save and Walgreens stores listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:25 PM Defendant Gilberto A Cortez in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Gilberto A Cortez. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/23/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
